### Random intervals

\begin{enumerate}

\item One-sample inference (confidence intervals and hypothesis testing) on the mean (Ch. 6.1, 6.2) under each of the following conditions: \begin{enumerate}
\item  When $n \ge 25$ and $\sigma^2$ is known.
\item  When $n \ge 25$ and $\sigma^2$ is unknown.
\item  When $n < 25$ and $\sigma^2$ is unknown.
\end{enumerate}     
  
\item All the above using:
\begin{enumerate}
\item Confidence intervals
\item Critical values and p-values
\end{enumerate}    
\item Inference for paired data under all the conditions in pt 2. (Ch. 6.3)
\item Inference for 2-sample data under all the conditions in pt 2 for each sample (Ch. 6.3)

\end{enumerate}
